metadata.Title: CVE-2020-24606 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Squid before 4.13 and 5.x before 5.0.4 allows a trusted peer to perform Denial of Service by consuming all available CPU cycles during handling of a crafted Cache Digest response message. This only occurs when cache_peer is used with the cache digests feature. The problem exists because peerDigestHandleReply() livelocking in peer_digest.cc mishandles EOF.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-24606` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.10-1ubuntu1.2
squid-cgi - 4.10-1ubuntu1.2
squid-common - 4.10-1ubuntu1.2
squid-purge - 4.10-1ubuntu1.2
squidclient - 4.10-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10-1ubuntu1.2').
